comments.commentBody: Sessions doesn't want to be convicted of treason, so he is getting out before the noose tightens around his neck. The rest of the treacherous Trump admin and GOP congressmen who are helping cover up the treasonous acts will not be so lucky. The question is: will they all be hung together or one by one?

The continuation of this administration without a very thorough investigation of the Russian connection to this entire administration would set a very dangerous precedent for our nation. But let's not take our eyes off all of the other dubious moves by this crew, there is no telling whats next.

replies.commentBody: Do the people who keep using the term "fake news stories" and "fake news media" realize that they sound delusional?  CNN is a real news outlet.  Just because you don't agree with what they say doesn't make them imaginary.  It is fascinating to see what people are willing to believe, simply because they want to identify with the "winning" president.  It's like finding out your favorite athlete used steroids to win and insisting he competed fairly.  It's just not accurate, whoever's side you're on.

replies.commentBody: Well that is what a full investigation is designed to determine. Let it be done.

An investigation is undertaken when there is evidence that a crime has been committed. In this case, there is none.
The FBI has said that repeatedly. Obama said that - at least until Clinton lost the election and the Democrats began seeking excuses. To date, all there has been is finger-pointing and innuendo.
The other reason some want "investigations" is as fishing expeditions. Open questioning, especially on TV, provides an opportunity for grandstanding, making defamatory statements, and wasting time and taxpayer money.

comments.commentBody: Democrats with their hair on fire! Guess what -there's no "there" there.

In science, a good way to tell an article hasn't been peer reviewed is to look at the reference section. The giveaway comes when all the references were written by the author of the paper in question.

We call that pseudo-science.

So was this article written to be used as a reference in future articles? I really don't see any other use for it. If that's the case, it should be called pseudo-news.

I just emailed my senators and demanded that they force Sessions  to resign, or else rescind his appointment because he perjured himself during his confirmation hearings. Now he whines, Oh gee, it was in my capacity as a senator that I chatted up the Russian ambassador, NOT NOT in my role as Trump surrogate or adviser or whatever, so that makes it OK. Sessions needs to be reminded that he shouted that Clinton lied in his Whitewater deposition, and that perjury was an impeachable offense. Sessions need to take his own medicine, and the GOP senators need to grow some spine and make it happen. Email your senators, call their offices, keep complaining. Stand up.

At least now the progressives will learn from fellow socialist travelers that nothing was done other than the usual email hackery.

The conviction held by our most gullible snowflakes that the wascally wussians had to have caused their all-time fave Hillary to lose her election is the preeminent sales job and public relations success of this century.

It will go down in history as even bigger than the merchandising of bottled water.

The democrats shouldn't worry about these unimportant votes. They will all go down harder after being confirmed, then be found lying. All are traitors to our country. Either hang em, or put them in solitary, never to see another person, talk to another person, get a letter, or any electronic communications from another human being. The cells will have a metal bench for sleeping (only allowed to lay down between midnight and 4am, the rest of the time they must stand. They will have a toilet, no sink or shower. Nutritious meals will be pushed under the door with no communication. Don't eat it, or push the tray back out no meals will be provided for 2 full days. No refuse will be removed unless pushed under the door. The door will only be opened upon proof (from surveillance cameras, we can see them) of death (decomposition or stink). Then bodies will be composted & then put in landfills. It's all they deserve. The only things they will have to do, is read classic literature (not the abridged ones). I figure *45 will go insane, for not seeing or hearing his name in about 2.5 days. Should make for profitable DVDs for the government to sell. He will begin crying in 1 hour after the door shuts for good. His feet will be removed for autopsy to look for bone spurs.

they cannot clear the air. A non-obstructionist attitude from them will lead to Trump's tax records, which are very likely to contain links to Russian financing. All should be tried for Treason, *45 for High Treason, once found guilty they should be incarcerated in solitary for life, no parole, the only way to get out of the cell, under 24/7 surveillance, is dead, or fully sedated. The cells kept at 75 degrees at all times, metal bench, no covers for a bed. Sleep naked hands in view at all times. No shower or sink, just a toilet. Nothing to do but read classic literature (unabridged), standing from 4am-midnight, 4 hours sleep. Both *45 & Bannon are the ones to hang. In public. With family (does Bannon have any who care?) right in front to see em loose it. If congress does this maybe we won't try the leaders for Treason, maybe.

comments.commentBody:
The evidence of Russian hacking of the US election would have to be substantial and actionable to justify any extraordinary efforts to "preserve the intelligence ... until the administration’s final hours. This was partly because intelligence was still being collected and analyzed, but it also reflected the sentiment among many administration officials that they had not recognized the scale of the Russian campaign until it was too late."

I understand the need for the intelligence community to protect "sources and methods" but I would think that maintaining the integrity of our electoral system would be a high enough priority to justify releasing as much information as possible to the American public. The best strategy to safeguard the intelligence material itself would be to make as much of it as possible a public record.

The contacts were first reported by The Washington Post.

comments.commentBody: Hillary and Obama caused the loss. Zero evidence Russia had any effect.

The whole discussion about Russian hacking into the DNC mail servers has a surreal touch. Anyone who knows Ed Snowden's story has every reason to believe that within the NSA and its affiliate companies there might be dozens, or even hundreds of "super users" who could, if they wanted, surrepetitiously breakt into those mail servers and copy masses of e-mail messages. These guys could probably even plant misleading leads to foreign domains so as to cover their footprints and shift the blame to others. Any meaningful investigation of these leaks should not start with blaming one randomly selected suspect but with determining who had the capabilities to hack those servers, followed by determining who had the motives to do so. We can certainly agree that the Russians had the motives but did they have the capabilities? This is obviously taken for granted by most, so nobody demands presentation of any evidence as to how they did it. If, on the other hand, dozens of NSA "super users" had the capabilities, we can be pretty sure that some among those digital wizards would have had sympathies for Trump and thus would have had the motive to hurt the Clinton campaign. Why are Russian hackers the only candidates that are seriously considered as suspects? Just because the alternate case would be embarrassing for the NSA?
